column4: in your grub menu, I recommend keeping the most up-to-date kernel, its recovery mode, then the 2nd-most up-to-date kernel, its recovery mode, and memtest
and keep a backup of your menu.lst, just to be safe
that seems reasonable. I wonder how all my Xen kernel and server kernel options snuck in here along the way
well I'm not too familiar with Xen functionality (the virtualization software?), so I'd hang on to those too, if you use that
